messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion]Addiction vs. focused
messages.msgSnippet: Having had many addicts in my life - I think the difference is when it interferes with the rest of your life and causes harm.  I can be really focused myself,
messages.messageBody:
Having had many addicts in my life -
I think the difference is when it interferes with the rest of your life
and causes harm. I can be really focused myself, but when I leave for
a week and have to go with out, I may *miss* my usual focus, but it
doesn't cripple me to be without it.
My friend who is now 15 or 16 years sober says he still feels the itch
all the time and has to work every day to stay away - not even butter
rum lifesavers for him.

Does that give any clarification? I know it isn't a concrete answer...
On Tuesday, August 26, 2003, at 11:23 AM,
Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> There is so much talk about addiction, nowadays. Does anyone have a
> really good definition?
--
Heather, mom to
Harriet 12.15.99
Crispin 01.25.02
heatherette@...


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
